bCXlFNMT03NWb_2UeOHTVQ.text: Went here tonight for the first time and it was delicious. All 4 of us liked what we got and the beer selection was amazing. Our server let us sample a beer before ordering. The fried pickles, pork BBQ, chicken BBQ, and burgers were all great!

BbdZhopCQE0rkGKPV48Ajw.text: i have been there 3 times every was great!! please note: when getting the $5 tacos you only get one.  the black bean quesadilla is good. our service the last time was great!!  the hush puppies you will get at your table. please note: the butter that comes with the hush puppies taste like some whipped ice cream!!! its sooooooooo good!!

Yj5in2L396EEl3YZ0sTo4A.text: We are visiting from out of town and we're looking for something sit down that wasn't fast food. Atmosphere is great. Service was okay. Food was good.  Would come back- but try something different.

MZU2Dgs06wLGYaNSXe4weQ.text: Wings were good and spicey...place was talked up way too much. I come from the land of perfect smoked meats (Austin, TX) so they had big shoes to fill....and could not even come close. I would say it's a good place to eat if you are visiting town and just want some decent smoked meats. If you have never been to Austin or had real Texas BBQ then you will like this place.

9MRnfqE09uGJWEs8uEZwFw.text: Macs hast to be my favorite Restaurant of all time. Macs is a very friendly Restaurant for family's. I have been going to Macs since I was about 10. Macs made me love Mac and Cheese. Mac and Cheese is honestly my favorite thing they have there. Even though it depends on the chef they can taste a little different. I order the 3 side car with Mac and Cheese, Fries, and a side Chopper Salad with Extra Bacon and Blue Cheese Dressing. Macs is friendly to family's because the people are so nice and they have a band outside on the patio on Thursdays.

Xb1sAyceCaEBYtdvh_7wyA.text: OMG, is all you would have to say about this place. It's amazing! I spent the last year in TX and didn't have anything remotely close to this. I have to say the Carolinas have BBQ down. The NC BBQ sauce and the SC mustard sauce was unlike anything I've ever tried..... the portions are beyond shareable or plenty leftovers any which way you do it you win! The only negative and I say that loosely was that there was an up charge for the combo plate "whole bunch" for choosing the spareribs and brisket which was not printed on the menu. I say full disclosure on pricing is a MUST. That aside it was pricey but worth every penny or in this case dollar.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States. The wings were the NC BBQ sauce and the SC mustard sauce. Best wings ever
Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States. The sample plate the larger portion minus the leg quarters which I had to remove to get to the meat on the bottom.

jJOzpRvy_UKAV0R_Gs0z7Q.text: Super reasonably priced! Really loved the Mac n cheese & fries. Their catfish was heavenly. (Did not like the creamed corn at all!). Large outdoor seating, great beer list, good service, and yummy yummy food.

XfuIFkVUOKTcWqKdwNaQZA.text: Great place to sit outside, have some good at a decent price and enjoy a variety beers/wines.   Staff was very friendly and music is classic rock selections.

NEwSd85QwVbGFDkzCcsjYA.text: This place is awesome!  The menu is great!  I have not had anything I didn't like.  I especially love the Thunderbird salad, it's my fav!  I usually get great service but this last time I wasn't pleased.  The waitress was kind of bland and dry.  She greeted us and took drink order but she forgot to ask my husband what he wanted to drink.  Then she brings hush puppies, which are free but I  didn't know,  and she Rudely responded with "They are free" after I told her we didn't order this.  Lastly, we were done and ready to go and she came to ask us if we wanted anything else, we said no, usually that means bring the check but she went on to the back took forever and came back to start cleaning tables.  I had to tell her Please process this payment asap because I had to go.  I was on a lunch break so needless to say I was late getting back to work.  I will eat there again because I love the food but I will request a different waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thunderbird salad with BBQ chicken.. Delicious!!

6gKFrPWcKlkBNdFyNqApAA.text: Great experience here. Came in for lunch and sat at the bar. Wanted to try everything and the bartender possible pointed me in the perfect direction. Pork was perfect, brisket was also perfect. The chicken is quite good, smoked and grilled. The St. Louis ribs where also great, ask for them dry for the True STL experience. Plus then you can use one of the great sauces of your choice. The vinegar sauce is great! Thanks for a great lunch. See you guys next time I'm in town.

1uUlgmS608jT7rTTQfUlsg.text: One of my favorite spots for BBQ!! And conveniently located across from my apartment complex.

NTEhRNEXNvf3fUNkT0ccnA.text: This is by far some of the best bbq ive had.  Ive never had the "carolina" version of bbq but this did not disappoint.  The atmosphere is loud and probably not good for kids, but the food makes up for it all.  Not to mention that they had my food out within 5 mins of me ordering piping hot!  Do yourself a favor and check this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States. Not the best pic but its the carolina brisket open face sandwich with fries.  So good!!!!

r-oxmChFMgD7roK5ebncrA.text: Service was friendly and nice, but was disappointed in the food. Chicken, collard greens, and Mac and cheese were good. The pork was over cooked and dry, but was better when I added some sauce. The ribs tasted good, but were a little over cooked.   The brisket however, never should have been served. It was flavorful, but tough. It was the toughest brisket I've ever had.   As a northerner, who's been looking forward to Southern BBQ, I was disappointed.

1RhlkT4DeqNgk0aOccll-g.text: One of the best beef briskets I ever had. The service and ambiance was great as well. Ordering was fast, and food showed up in a reasonable amount of time. Can't wait to go back!

89z4tBpsYL6i8dGGJRgUHQ.text: Great barbeque with plenty of tv's for entertainment and beers FOR DAYS! Highly recommend the brisket tips!

ZLt4Jc4qHINh18OPbnNFRg.text: I only stopped here from a recommendation from a friend who said when I drive through, I must stop here even if its for pick up. WOW! I ordered the burnt ends, full rack of ribs, mac and cheese and a pulled pork sandwich for my wife. I couldn't have been happier with what I ordered. The place was packed, but I still got my order very quickly when I showed up. I even took a peek at the draft list, and if I wasn't already running behind to pick my wife up, I would have had a pint or two because the selection was awesome! About the food.... The burnt ends were flavorful and tender. I had to wrestle my wife away from my ribs because they were so juicy and delicious. The next time we are driving through Charlotte, I am going to make sure this is a stop we make for a sit down experience because this place was great!

tlOm52BrfVh6WhDq_rAwqA.text: Today seemed like a good day to have some pork, pull pork that is. I Went with my team to have lunch. I forgot it is Saturday, I was not expecting it to be so full. I do enjoy the military pricing and the great service.

jINkHUhTlXrnPv3kunhdgA.text: Fiance said the prime rib sandwich was the best thing he has ever eaten. My brisket tacos and deviled eggs were great too!

4XeL3yh3xCwueS6Ly7_1QQ.text: This is a tough one. I love the vibe and the open air concept but the wait staff was less than friendly and the food was mediocre at best. We tried the nachos which I thought was the best thing we had and the fried pickles. I had the porktastic sandwich and I wasn't impressed. Hubs had the tacos and thought that the buffalo chicken were very good.

WBPCNL_G_5zh0EdeQrj-Bg.text: Yum! Mac's is a go-to for me, especially when I've got guests in town who want some good BBQ and a fun atmosphere. The pulled pork is great, but I absolutely love their beer can chicken. I recommend getting a tray and picking a couple sides--all of which are delicious, but the Mac and Cheese is a must have. They have a fantastic drink selection, so everyone stays happy. I also LOVE the hush puppies they serve when you sit down. Weekends are busy, but you'll always get a seat whether it's inside or on the covered patio. Weekdays are pretty fun too. They've got a live band and the atmosphere stays pretty lively. Definitely recommend!

FZ8GMRf_fMmuUYiW-GI-EQ.text: Wow.  I was not planning to come here on my trip to Charlotte.  We went to a bar to watch the NBA Rising Stars game and grab a drink etc. and by the time it was over it was late (around 12:30 am on a Friday) and we were hungry.  I used yelp to look up what was in the area that was open and had good ratings and Mac's popped up.  When we arrived, the place was bright and lit up and there were several people inside either enjoying a drink or having some food.  We grabbed a seat at the bar and a friendly waitress/bartender came over and dropped of menus, and then delivered some of the best news of the night... the whole mexicue section is half off till closing!! I promptly ordered a brisket quesadilla ($5.25 with the discount) and a Pulled Pork Taco ($2.50).  The quesadilla was LOADED with brisket and it was really good.  I decided then and there that I was going to come back on Monday to revisit the brisket quesadilla and try one of the other tacos as well as imbibing in the $3.00 pints special they have on Monday night.  Unfortunately I never made it back on Monday b/c I was too full from a lunch from another purveyor of bbq meats, but I still wish I had stopped by on Monday.  This place has a laid back setting, plenty of TVs with sports, and friendly staff.  If I'm ever in the area again, this is one of the first places that I am going for food.

pH0UK1GKQohgbE_3KsDhzw.text: Awesome food great vibes and live music! I'm sure we will be going here often!services were on time and they checked on us which most waitresses don't while having a busy night.I asked a bunch of questions about the food and they were so helpful!! I totally forgot to get her name but they were  all so sweet! Thank y'all!!

6xTfHY3vWCP4UN2IcJevBg.text: Food is good and waiters are always kind and enjoyable. Good place for an affordable and quality meal

nYz5mOsyEWsVoqCSN2bbEA.text: I had heard a lot of great things about Mac's. It was hard to get a seat.  I ordered the southwest salad and was very disappointed. The picked onions were overwhelmingly strong and it made my salad inedible. However, the fried pickles were pretty tasty!

UUn2RCOdflzIggUaJaxSxg.text: Not only does Macs have a great atmosphere but the food is awesome! Definitely come here for some classic Carolina barbecue and make sure to save room for their hush puppies. They have a nice patio outside that had a live band. It was great to watch the basketball games and then stay to hang out for awhile.

c0vBR0i8dPhcif_kVOXmiA.text: Okay...so this is the thing...  First, before I start, I want to say that I'm leaving this review out of love. I originally gave this place 5 stars. I literally had never had a subpar experience here until tonight. The food is usually hot and ready like Little Caesars and my servers are always on point, but tonight........   Whew chile... MESSY. So on May 24th around 10:30PM, my friends and I decided we wanted some drinks and a nice meal after having our very first "manifestation night". We got together and discussed positive things we wanted for our futures and how we could take actionable steps to get there. After tonight, I think we may invite the entire staff that was over outside seating to our next one and manifest positivity and friendliness because everybody's face out there was just as SOUR as could be. I don't know who took a fat #2 on their upper lip, but almost EVERYBODY had the stank face. Literally what manager pissed y'all off in the team meeting beforehand?! I swear when I finally hit it big, I'm buying all of you guys edible arrangements to apologize for whoever called out today and made the shift extra hard!!!! Y'all were FED UP in that room! The spirit of wanna-go-home was THICK in the room tonight!!!! I really want servers, busboys/girls, and bartenders to understand that YOU create the experience for the customer. If you present yourselves to us as if you don't want to be there, we are more than likely going to present that same energy back in the form of your tip.   Notice I said ALMOST everyone had the stank face. Everyone had it except our waitress who will go unnamed because she was a nice girl, but sis, your service was wack and you know it. Friend, you offered us hushpuppies while we decided what we wanted to eat and didn't bring them until you brought our checks and COOKS... they were burnt! Scorched. Char-grilled. MIDNIGHT. We didn't even ask for the hushpuppies. YOU offered them and then disappeared into Narnia. On top of that, y'all only had 3 drafts to choose from for my friend. You brought her a drink menu to pick from the 3???? Lmao. And then never came back to get her drink order. She sat with the menu in her hand until we left lololol. The way you disappeared sis, I think you should've auditioned for Genie in this new Aladdin film. Would've knocked Will Smith clean out the water.    I ALWAYS get ribs when I come here because they are delicious and fall off the bone tender. WHEW! Y'all didn't disappoint on those, but something told me to tell y'all to fry my fries HARDT, but I went against my better judgment and didn't say anything. Just as I thought, they were lukewarm and soggy. From the way those roasted cannonballs called hushpuppies looked, you guys could've just put the fries in the same grease. DAMN.   And lastly, PLEASE turn the fans down. Who are y'all trying to cool off?! The only person who needs fans up that high is BEYONCE and she's hitting constant back-to-back 8-counts. As a contact wearer, I felt like y'all were trying to blind me and y'all don't know me from a can of paint. Hell, were y'all DRYING paint?!  I typically love this place, but tonight was a hot dog ass mess. 2 stars because the ribs were good. Service was a comedy reel sis. A JOKE. I'm not gonna rat you out to the whole Charlotte foodie community because you were friendly the 2 TIMES I saw you the entire night, but just do better.   And yes, I STILL tipped.

GxLEYhs9SDY0iUQVQc78rw.text: We have enjoyed going to Mac's Speed Shop for several years. Tonight, after picking up a carryout order we were quite disturbed.  We ordered two beef rib dinners, two sides each.  When we got back home we discovered that our meals were packed in flimsy cardboard boxes!  The salad was wilted and warm from the steam from other food. One side had been left out completely, one dinner had no bread. We paid $55.00 for meals that were a sloppy mess. While Mac's is a good place to visit, I caution against ordering takeout.  I was told by the manager that the new packing boxes are biodegradable. While that is a nice concept, it degrades the quality of the food.

GVChwR6xBbevyMEOGOOveQ.text: The smoked wings were tasty, although not nearly as yummy as many of the smoked wings I've had in N.C. so far. I'd give them a 2.5 out of 5 because they were dry which left the meat a bit crumbly and chewy.  The complimentary hush puppies were super yum. Overall is wasn't bad for what it was. I'll return to try the beef rib.

-10NVDE5IYZ3QbMjLSmMtg.text: My coworkers and I came here for lunch.  It was my first time here so I was enamored with the garage themed decor and TVs everywhere.  This place serves some good Q.  We opted to sit in their patio area and were promptly greeted by our server.  Drinks came out quickly and I ordered the beer can chicken (half/dark).  It was absolutely delicious.  The chicken skin was a little crispy and there were nice hints of the smoke they used to cook it.  It was so good, I stopped using the barbeque sauces they have on the table.  My sides were the cole slaw and the green bean casserole, both were very good.  Will return next time.

It's a must try! Our server Jasmine, and the manager Mitch made our experience unforgettable with a deep feeling of being welcomed. Thank you for everything!

ilL9NmzONgIKWhIPpU-T_w.text: Excellent service, really good Bloody Mary to kick off my day and the brisket quesadilla was everything I needed.  Thanks!!!!

5SFQ76OTitO-B53zauL_Sw.text: My husband and I were driving around Charlotte after a medical appointment trying to find somewhere we can both agree on to eat. Of course I went to Yelp and looked at the area we were circling. Knowing that my husband will always try barbecue I happened upon Mac's. It wasn't far away and so we started our journey. I was pleasantly surprised when I saw the menu and was even more surprised after trying the food.  The barbecue was moist without running with sauce. I found the staff to be very friendly and although they were very busy with a large lunch crowd we did not wait long for service or our food. The inside of this restaurant is decorated similarly to a biker bar. There is not a lot of parking in the area and a couple of places will tow you so be careful.  The brisket was so flavorful and had just enough fat to make it moist without leaving a greasy taste in your mouth.    The collards were delightful.  Perfectly cooked.  I noticed in 2017 they won Whole Hog at Memphis in May. That is a very telling honor  Lastly want to talk about their menu. They have a slew of sides, wings, Mexicue, sauce to go, beer, cider, and barbecue of all kinds.  This is a place you can bring Grandma, Mom, uncle, teenagers, kids and yourself and everyone will always find something to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hushpuppies
Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States

HwWTK8ymh7wCn6tDCqvZEA.text: It doesn't get any more comforting than enjoying Southern favorites, like dry rubbed and smoked BBQ, Beer-braised Chicken, Mac 'n Cheese, cheddar Grits, and waitstaff that make you feel at home. In the mood for something else? Not to worry-- try the Wing Ding. Grilled, dry-rubbed (which gives the wings remarkable flavor), and hickory smoked Jumbo chicken wings, tossed in your choice of favorite sauce. Smoky, sweet mother of God.  Some of Mac's favorite sauces and rubs: - Red and Carolina BBQ sauces. - Brisket and chicken dry rubs. - SC Mustard sauce.  Side notes: - You can take home your favorite sauces ($1-$5) and rubs ($8). - Half price Mexicue (tacos and quesadillas) on weekdays 3PM - 6PM. - On Tuesdays, you'll get a free kids meal with the purchase of adult entree. - This spot is a popular biker barbecue joint and sports bar. - If you are a craft beer fan, join Mac's Beer Club(BC), where you can track your beer roster and earn points - for every 100 points you earn, you will receive $5 in Mac's money to spend on food or retail merchandise.  - Try Brisket Philly Wrap. Yummy! - The Mac's Beer Club is where members can track their beer roster and view their points that they have earned.

8IhdfQmJ72aWAbRpmuHwvw.text: Went here on a Sunday and ordered the catfish  with cheese grits and collard greens. The catfish was fried way too long. The greens taste a few days old and the grits were not fully cooked and grainy. Returned back the cheese grits for the mac n' cheese and that was bland.  My friend had their wings and he eats there every chance he gets and even he didn't finish his meal.    I would definitely recommend them having regular tartar sauce as a substitute for the jalapeno tartar sauce. Especially, when eating catfish.  The bartender was really cool. She has great customer service skills and makes the best drinks.

SuDljD_G_zyq8jmj2taoMg.text: Visited for an early dinner on Tuesday and was quite impressed with the food and service.  I had the smoked chicken wings with the vtx chipotle sauce.  Very good wings, very large and perfect smoke flavor.  I also had the southwest salad which is full of delicious stuff.  They have a good thing going here and I recommend this place if you appreciate good smoked meats and awesome beers.

1V8HZ2QfMNlhaHm6U1pgzA.text: I am unable to write a review of the food, because we never received our meals.  A group of five of us were seated outside, where there was live music.  The band was not so loud that you could not have conversations at the table. It was a little slow getting our first round of drinks, but we didn't mind as we were enjoying the music and people watching.  We finally placed our orders of fried pickles and onion rings along with our meals.  While sitting there, several other parties were seated and their orders taken. Well, the other parties received their appetizers, meals and checks, while we sat.  The waitress had to be flagged down to order a second beverage, which again took much longer than it should given that the place was not very crowded.  After everyone around us had left, the waitress was again flagged down...no we had to find her and ask where our meals were.  She was told that we were getting ready to leave since everyone around us had been served and left...while we waited.  A few minutes later, a man (assuming he was the manager) came to the table and said that he just found out that we had been waiting.  duh...  By this time, we were frustrated and ready to leave.  We were offered the food to go, but it was too late.  We had been there at least 90 minutes...waiting. The waitress never apologized or offered an explanation for the delay.  I believe that she forgot to put in the order to the kitchen. This restaurant probably has good BBQ, but needs to improve its service.

VU1IfFl4YZgx4sHABCpW0Q.text: This place is great every time you go. Staff is always friendly, doing their best to make you happy. Prices are reasonable and the craft beer selection is on point! I've been here numerous times since they opened and never had a bad experience.

6PTVD0RmPlok0xybojUeAw.text: If you're looking for a nice atmosphere that and great food Mac's is a solid choice. The atmosphere is loud and nothing about this place is fancy. It claims to be a place for bikes, babes, and beer, and in addition to its great food has an extensive beer selection. This place gets all five stars because it has a nice atmosphere,  service, and great food (especially the wings -- and try the hog wings too!)  One follow-up note: the last two times the wings have not been consistent. Sometimes they are good, but unfortunately leave room for improvement. Still like the place. Adjusted review to four stars.

VVMRVbBYse8XrRxLjbaqwA.text: Really good BBQ place. They can get pretty busy and the parking is limited but it's worth it.  They have an outdoor area as well with it's own bar and TV. I think they do live music there as well. The indoor part is set up long way with booths and high tops. Decent amount of seating and there's a bar with seating as well.  The food is really good here. Brisket and the ribs are amazing.  The staff here are great too. Just enough attention and very nice. Love this place.

GfXlSwZKif0DGAzHF3kPpQ.text: This restaurant never disappoints. The staff is just OnPoint with your friendly smile and great service. If you ever stop in for lunch they understand you may be crunched for time so you never waiting a long time for your food. This is one restaurant I don't have to ask for anything napkins straws is always provided without mention it and I have been to several even high end restaurants that don't give me the service that I get here. So you know the service is good and the food is great.

TE7-7UkcfLBpNEEdhCR8_w.text: Macs is my favorite restaurant on South Blvd.  Rachel Sunderland always makes the visit excellent!

dHHK9B79tQMD143U2J4V0g.text: This is a good hangout. Loads of beer and the wine is generously served for $8.00 a glass. We got some good hush puppies that are on the house and got the sampler- the pork,ribs and chicken were plentiful but only 1 small slice of brisket. The sides were good and the Texas toast was cold, dry and had no taste.

7B2DgSC586UgYlndXfusYw.text: I can't even imagine how or why I would ever return to this place again.  They clearly need to rethink their staffing.  Especially the blondish Amazon at the hostess stand out front.  She managed to completely ruin a once in a lifetime moment!  I returned to Charlotte to celebrate a landmark birthday with a very close friend.  Oddly enough, when asked where she would like to have dinner, she chose this place after only having been there twice before.  When we arrived, we were asked if we preferred to be seated inside or out.  I turned to my guest and said loud enough for the Amazon to hear, "It's your birthday, (notice the subtle hint), you decide"  The place was busy, but there were table dotted throughout the inside dining area.  The Amazon knows this is a birthday dinner.  So where does she seat us?  Under the television, in the back, quite close to the noisy kitchen.  ARE YOU FREAKING KIDDING ME?!  Because my guest is so gracious, she says nothing.  It only takes a minute or two of not hearing anything the other is saying to know this will not work.  My guest walks back over to the Amazon to ask if we might change to outdoor seating.  It would have to have been quieter than where we were.  We were moved outside with minimal fuss.  Open tables were dotted all around the outdoor seating as well.  Remember, the reason we asked for the change of seating was noise.  Also remember that the Amazon should know this was a birthday dinner.  When the waitress comes over just a few minutes later to take a drink order, we are shouting at each other while barely hearing each other.  Why, you ask?  BECAUSE THE AMAZON SAT US RIGHT NEXT TO THE OUTDOOR STAGE, AND WE HAD NO IDEA A BAND WAS ABOUT TO START.  C'mon!!  By the way, the band was a bunch of old dudes that opened playing a Led Zeppelin tune.  As God is my witness, I have heard high school aged garage bands do it better.  WTF?!  We did the only thing left for us to do - Get the heck out of Dodge!  Some things only happen once in a lifetime.  For what this place did to that once in a lifetime, I can only wish them a slow and painful death....

eh9uQFGVL1l_LbscyN6dJQ.text: Unfortunately this location attracts a somewhat rough crowd of bikers that like to slash your tires. So if you like your car, you might want to consider a different option.

7Sq1lVQ9FgwfehHaFR6lgw.text: We had this catered to my office and it was delicious.  Large portions and the sides were out of this world.  We had the Barbeque and smoked wings for our meat and both were great!  The award for the best side goes to the green bean casserole. The mac and cheese was also delicious.  The order was delivered a little early which was problematic because we had told everyone a specific time. It had to sit 15 minutes before it was served.

n3xM7X8FA0sbdYJgM_ev9w.text: I recommend the BBQ here, as I didn't have any meat that wasn't tender. However, I prefer the sauce heated and mixed into my pulled BBQ, and found it a little bland on its own. They do offer several different kinds of sauces on the side, and this offers diversity, but heating the sauce with the meat really makes a flavor difference. The ribs were fantastic just the way they come!  I also really enjoyed their chili! They offer an option to serve the chili with cheese and other toppings, which is great with tortilla chips as an appetizer.  Unfortunately, the sides were not great. My brother in law is known for cooking a full pig every few months, and my large Southern family really brings it with the sides, so perhaps I am just partial :) I must say, after trying the greens, beans, fries, slaw, potato salad, and mac and cheese, I was a bit disappointed. The mac and cheese was dry; the greens were too salty and not vinegary at all, the slaw was not very sweet or creamy, and the fries were a little over cooked. The beans and potato salad were good. :)   This was not my favorite BBQ stop because of the sides, which is one of my favorite parts of a BBQ place, and the "unsauced" pulled meat. Also, they do not offer fried okra, which I feel is a necessary staple.  The beer selection is quite good, with several local options. Also, they have live music frequently and a good size patio. These elements combine into a great happy hour or evening location!  Overall, try it out for the meat, beer selections, and the ambiance. Though I grew up in NC, by no means am I a BBQ expert, and this is simply my humble opinion.

kHqtzw6IV-w7hq60RSAlBA.text: Fried pickles are the best here.  If this sounds strange, just try them, they are great. The BBQ is great.  Atmosphere is fun, a little loud but still very good place to host a get together. Every time I am in Charlotte I go here.   I will be back.

5YiCzev3x3Woxw7GK070oA.text: I'm rating Mac's Speed Shop 2 STARS for HORRIBLE customer service. Now, don't get me wrong, I've been here plenty of times to both eat & drink, but this time, I was introduced to the waitress Amanda who was extremely rude.   So, my friend and I live in South End right across the street from this establishment so we go here quite often, but I've never been treated with such distain. We ordered our food and I got  the Spark Plug burger which is a 10 oz. burger, pepper jack cheese, pickled jalapenos, applewood smoked bacon, chipotle aioli, lettuce, tomato, & onion. I added guacamole and a whole bunch of other items which I think began the hatred towards us. From that point on, Amanda was rude, never checked on us, and just basically acted like we were the scum of the earth (we're paying customers, I thought).   We get our food and it's just the way I like it. I have no complaints about the food. It was a delicious burger. My friend and I finish eating and she brings our checks w/o us even asking did we want anything else. Now, this is where the 2 stars come in. She puts my friends check down on the table and literally THROWS MY CHECK @ ME and walks away!! We both looked @ each other in astonishment. Not only was that rude, but I wasn't done ordering. I wanted another beer, so I literally had to look @ the check for her name to get her attention to place my drink order. She gets an attitude from that. So, my friend pays and she takes the thrown check back b/c she has to update my receipt with my extra drink order. AMANDA never comes back so I get up and proceed to go to the hostess stand to pay/speak with someone. She yells and say "YOU DIDN'T PAY YOUR BILL" and I respond "You never brought it back". So, I hand her my card and pay for my order per usual, but I leave her two tips:   1) Monetary compensation even though she didn't deserve it.  2) Don't throw checks @ the people that help put food on your table.   Conclusively, I will still go back b/c they have excellent food, but I don't want to deal with Amanda ever.   Side Note: I went to the bar last Sunday and didn't get good service @ all. The only thing I did was have two Blue Moons, but since it was 11:00pm and they were about to close @ midnight, the bartender was not paying us any attention. So, Mac's Speed Shop, PLEASE, get some better servers or adopt a better training program b/c they will be the death of you.   Thanks!  --Your South End Friend

idujmcMNMXxYVhHGCc5NUw.text: After a 5 hour flight delay, I needed to eat dinner before crashing for the night.  Luckily, Mac's is open late and on the way from the airport and to my hotel.  I sat at the bar because they were closing (it was 11:30) and ordered the pulled pork with 2 sides; mac and cheese and cheese grits.  The pork was ok, very dry and not a lot of flavor until I added additional BBQ sauce on it, i'm not sure if that was because it was so late but I was disappointed since I was craving Carolina pulled pork.  The mac and cheese was good but the highlight of the meal was the cheese grits.  I'd like to come back and give this place another shot but with so many other options I'm not sure I will.

qbtg9bTJXDWMrRcSHgft-g.text: Use to come here quite a bit, but no longer in the area. Went in for lunch today with my sister and was so disappointed  our server spoke literally to us ONLY when she had to. We were seated for more than 5 minutes before someone came and took our drink order and announced our server would be with us soon. She was. For about 15 seconds. She never checked on us, we never got drink refills, and it took entirely too long to get out check.  Being a former server and bartender, I get the concept of a lunch rush- but I also pay attention, and our server spent significantly more time with her male tables. I usually tip 25% or more for even decently good service, but she was lucky to get the $4 on a $29 dollar bill that we left. I was so taken back by the lack of service. Only reason this review gets 3 stars is because the food was good.

l0LzhJ8r5DNp8w3G9-PJtw.text: Worst ribs ever. They were smothered in too much sauce I guess to cover up how dry the meat was. There was very little meat on the bone. Very disappointed. Tasted 4 days old.

NXp1_MSOsVDzMaMs7QMYsw.text: Really confused by the good reviews here. The food at this place is not good and being new to this area, even I would hesitate to call it authentic "NC BBQ".  I've been here twice now and it was disappointing both times. I had the pulled chicken BBQ sandwich the first time and it was dry and bland. I had the spinach salad with blackened chicken today and the chicken was too salty and the flavors just didn't go well together.  It seems like people go to this place more for the ambiance and probably cause it's been a neighborhood favorite all these years. Who knows.   I've had BBQ in Raleigh and so I have a sense of what BBQ is supposed to taste like. With the exception of Soul and the Cellar, the food scene in Charlotte is just sadly mediocre.

r3zYBj3KqHaW2h6qtQ1aqw.text: Never had a bad meal here. The BBQ is decent (its not Lexington), and the staff is usually fairly friendly.

XZJu50NBvItkUeoK-x_Jxw.text: One of my favorite barbeque joints in the city, this place simply rocks.   For starters the atmosphere is laid back and cool with a biker/grunge theme that is perfect for grabbing beer with friends and listening to great music.   More important is the food and they knock it out of the park. I have tried many different items on their menu. Barbeque, burgers, beer can chicken, quesadilla, you name it. For me the True winner is their wings. They are some of the best I have had in Charlotte. Not only are they smoked to perfection but they come with a variety of choices for sauces. I find myself always going back to the wings!  Also one time on my way there to join friends I had an embarrassing wipe out on a Lime scooter. My server was kind enough to bring me a wet nap to wipe the blood off my face. Cheers!

PB_6WsM2ywRiVBS_QVJrPg.text: I seem to be striking out big time on my trip to Charlotte. Our hotel recommended this restaurant. The environment was nice. Lots of tables inside and out, casual seating. A fun $3 mystery beer "game" to play for the happy hour. Also, the prices were good!  The Mac & Cheese was insanely good. So was the brownie sundae thing (big enough to easily share with a table...or two).  The pulled pork sandwich was disappointing. It tasted over cooked and had very little flavor. Think leftover pulled pork that you forgot to season and left in a fridge a few days and reheated in a microwave.  The margarita was straight syrup. I had a few sips and decided I didn't need that negativity in my life.  So instead I transferred the negativity of my food experience to this review. Also the waitress was very slow to bring things out and was not very friendly...

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States

FJDVKc-sV6buBG9CUXJD1g.text: I've always loved Mac's, especially the smoked wings... But tonight was awful. I ordered online and it wasn't even in the system when we showed up. Apparently the system was down. No problem - they'd put the order in and gave a beer while we waited. Got the order home and instead of 8 BBQ and 8 buffalo wings, we got 16 extra burned buffalo. My mouth is on fire as I pick bits of crumbling charcoal out of my teeth. I always recommend mac's as the best place for wings in Charlotte. I don't know if I'll ever get them again after tonight. They were practically inedible. The chef knows he shouldn't have sent those out.... Being busy is no excuse. In the past I've given mac's recommendations and 5 stars. After tonight, I don't even want to give you $5. This picture almost makes them look edible.  UPDATE: Mac's contacted me and worked to resolve the problems the next day. Hooray for great customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burned wings with the wrong sauce

oqRgQ8MoLD-xGsYpvTkg7A.text: Went here after work & they have some great daily deals. I got the beer can chicken white & it was a little dry. I sent it back for wings & there was a issue with the Mac & cheese also, however the manager immediately came out & resolves the issue & comp the meal. It wasn't my first visit at Macs & my food is always usually good so I definitely would recommend them.

IFCFQXSSKr3xkf_oft1EJw.text: Mac's will keep you coming back, simply because the food is GOOD!  I stopped in for lunch with co-workers. It's a little loud and crowded in here, nothing fancy or romantic. Lot's of sports paraphernalia on the walls, major Southern vibes. Tons of burgers and BBQ options. House made sauces. And complimentary hush puppies! OMG THE HUSH PUPPIES. They serve hot hush puppies with honey butter while you wait for your food, sooooo yummy!  I dont eat meat, so I tried the black bean burger with mushrooms, lettuce/tomato and added some sauce - DELICIOUS! The burger bean patty was kind of big and messy, but I didn't mind. It was super good.   On the down side, the service in here was very mediocre. Our waitress forgot to add something I asked for, we had to flag her down for a good minute.... because we needed straws. She didn't check on us at all. There is def room for improvement in the service department.   Nevertheless, if GOOD FOOD is what you're searching for, and you don't mind some juicy, fried stuff, Mac's is an excellent option. Be mindful this area gets busy during peak hours, and the parking lot can also get full. With all the construction in the area, parking can be a little difficult. But I dont mind, I'll be returning for those hush puppies very soon!

HdxHNISNF6Nm7T-77N2xgA.text: I met my daughter for lunch and we ate at Mac's Speed Shop. Good thing I got there early as parking is not plentiful. I got a space in their lot but my daughter had to park down the street.  So be warned. It was very crowded which was a good sign. The place has a lively vibe and the menu choices are certainly ample.  They give you a basket of hot, delicious hush puppies with a cinnamon-like butter while you wait for your food. SCRUMPTIOUS!!  I had a beer chicken with collard greens and baked beans. The banana pudding for dessert was pretty good tThere are a variety of bbq sauces on the table. I enjoyed my food and would certainly go back.  Update:  So I met my daughter for lunch here again and we had the beer can chicken. I had a side of collards and baked beans. My daughter had a side of green bean casserole and Mac and cheese.  Overall, it was all pretty good. My collard greens were delicious. My only concern was the size of my quarter dark chicken. It was HUGE!! Way too much meat. How in the world is the chicken that big?! On a lighter note, the complimentary hush puppies are delicious. I would return, but I wouldn't get the chicken. It kind of scared me. LOL!!

Au-E2KCLcpVPYQbfHg5y_g.text: If you want some Smack Yo Mama good BBQ....this is the spot for you. The hush puppies are AMAZING, you will get hooked. *don't say I didn't warn you*

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States. Do you see this?!

CZKY-wrgRLMDpDfvXm6OEw.text: Have to give this place high ratings for - service, ambiance, beer selection, and excellent bbq.   Had a few local beers on the recommendation of the bartender, she was spot on on 4 of the 5 I had.  I would rate a local west coast style IPA "higher ground" as the best.  Also on her recommend, I ordered the burnt ends starter which was quite good ; a good salt rub and sweet bbq sauce. A few pieces were a little dry-ish but when one came along that was moist and easy to chew, it was heaven.   Love meeting new people when I come to places like this and bartenders Amanda and Nadine were so cool!  Not to mention really good at what they do.   Sat and watched the masters with a playlist of classic rock playing overhead.  Finished with Marshall Tucker's "Can't you see" which was icing on the cake.  Speaking of cake, they had it but I didn't try it....next time, cuz I plan on coming back.

nZJBcmXu6DGpzU_GFv62sQ.text: Stopped in to grab an early dinner during a business trip because it was the highest rated BBQ place near my hotel, and I was not disappointed! I changed from my plan of brisket when I saw that they had smoked wings. They were DELICIOUS! I had the dry rub and the classic hot buffalo flavor. Juicy and flavored perfectly! It is located in a cool little area south of the "Uptown" area and had a great patio facing the main road where you can watch passerby and still enjoy the music and see sports on TV. Bustling vibe and great service. Definitely want to stop by again and try more of the menu on my next Charlotte visit! Oh, I almost forgot! The hush puppies and honey butter that they serve when you sit down are THE BOMB! I had to consciously keep myself from hosing down the entire basket within a matter of minutes! So good!

photos.caption: Photo of Mac's Speed Shop - Southend - Charlotte, NC, United States

7iN0yCfX8YN8gO1sexxXKQ.text: So there is no way to pick a fav between this location and the Matthews location...both serve delish complimentary hush puppies w/to-die-for bacon grease butter and reuben+chedd grits!  Both locations offer fantastic (and sometimes rare) beer offerings for ridiculously awesome prices and the staff at each is just beyond incredible!   So if you have to choose, it will have to be solely on your actual geographic location when you're having a craving for amazing beer + food & those hush puppies!  5th star is for Sarah, my bartender and newfound foodie soulmate, and her incrediballs beer recs, service, and keeping me in great company during my visit!

6ASdTCClj8H7vazIKQcl1g.text: Great restaurant with good barbecue and brisket. Fries are on point! Green bean casserole and fries pickles are my go to add on sides and appetizers. Deducting one star because parking can get dicey!

1ehnpvIYzRPVcMKMZbhi6g.text: I reviewed this Mac's location in July 2009 but the Yelp hamsters decided to move that review to the Mac's in Fayetteville NC (about three hours away) and I've just let it be.  Today's stop was for a take out order of ribs for my wife. Mac's has a bunch of televisions tuned to sports, a loud rock and roll music channel going and they attract a pretty good biker crowd on some nights. Parking can definitely be a challenge at times and I'm pretty sure that the animal clinic next door won't like you leaving your car there.  Ribs were awesome. Very meaty, very tender, very delicious. I got to smell them in the car the whole ride home and was lucky to get *one* as a tip for the delivery. The rest disappeared as good food tends to do.  Cole slaw was good and tangy, the collard greens were quite sharp.  Overall, we're a fan of Mac's and will be back again.  [Review 9929 overall, 1508 of 2018.]

sZezElAUN4vg1eoenZsWhg.text: What is wrong with people in Charlotte?  I feel like you are all super critical.  You give 2 stars because your pulled pork was dry?  Although everything else was fabulous?  Let's try and be a bit more understanding for a slow waitress.  Maybe it was her first week. Or maybe someone called in sick. Whatever it is, it is no reason to give a restaurant 2 stars.  Things would have had to be terrible for that rating.  But it doesn't sound like there was anything terrible about your visit. Stop taking out your frustrations on innocent businesses just trying to make a living!

VNmhmSnOLUUoJlU7DkaUNA.text: Phenomenal BBQ! Very expansive beer menu featuring plenty of wonderful offerings from North Carolina, especially the the hot spots of Asheville and Charlotte.  Fried pickles, and pork skins were delicious appetizers. For meats, the ribs were out of this world, but the brisket was even better!

Z7qCgwOK4Xe99m0QD6T8eA.text: I've eaten here a couple of times, and I don't know why I can't seem to deviate from the same selection of food!  I ordered my usual half rack of St. Louis ribs.  This time, I tried different sides:  collard greens and sweet potato fries.  The meat was tender and flavorful, with the sauce a bit on the sweet side. I didn't fancy the greens as much. Again, it's on the sweet side. I normally prefer a more savory flavor with some heat. The fries were decent. It's nice to have a choice different from normal potato fries.  Service was friendly. The setting was fun.  I understand that there's music, but I guess I've missed it when I've been there.

czd8LJ2Z1xXb9OR4FeXLrg.text: Cool experience at Mac's although we enjoyed Midwood more.  They had an extensive beer menu and prices were fair.  The sides were excellent (grits and onion rings) but my brisket was a bit too firm. Felt more like eating a steak then brisket.

NHoOzRlM5l4GRpyVxvfq-Q.text: I just finished taking 5 classes at my college for the semester and my husband wanted to take me out to celebrate. We always try to find places to eat at that we haven't visited before. This was one of them. We came here on Wednesday night. It was jamming with lots of people and some TVs showing basketball games. This place was a little loud but it was something we just had to deal with. Not a big deal.   We ordered a few drinks. They gave us some hush puppies to munch on. The dip it comes with was interesting. Nice little snack before our meals. I ordered the "Spark Plug" with fries and my husband ordered the "Pastrami Reuben" with collard greens. We both loved our food. But I must say... the fries WERE AMAZING. I haven't had GOOD fries in a LLOONNGG time and these nailed it! Great place to eat. Would definitely come back!

CCHymy-83PxKM7tL-Av9-A.text: Came to Mac's Speed Shop after seeing great reviews. Frankly I was disappointed.   First of all-parking is difficult. The street parking or the neighbor vet hospital have towing enforcement signs.  The restaurant and bar are cute and waitresses are attractive and flirtatious which is always fun.  Lots of drinking options.  Hush puppies are complementary, but the first order came in cold. We asked for more and this is the highlight of the visit.   Service is rather poor. Refills or checking up on you, or getting condiments were all sub par.   I ordered burger and my friend had BBQ. My burger was supposed to be medium and instead one side was well done, and the other one was raw. I also ordered Mac and Cheese which was terrible. Watered down and tasteless. 99 cent packages I was making in college are better!  My friend's BBQ was about the same. He found a piece of plastic in his pulled pork!!! So much for dinning experience.  If I was a manager, I would certainly retrain the wait staff and hire new cooks!!!

raSytEgedvdoo4K6GLC2LQ.text: Great brisket! Tender and flavorful! We have dined here countless times. Consistently a great experience with large portions. Nice and quick service as well. I would recommend them for anyone who enjoys great barbecue.

oPQjvomq7ni7LDQHCO2T7Q.text: I love Macs Speed Shop.  The food is incredible, the service is excellent, and the ambiance is fun.  I love the brisket.  I usually get the brisket wrap.  It melts in your mouth.   They have excellent wings, fried pickles, hush puppies , bbq, I could go on forever.   There are plenty of tvs to watch the games and there is an outdoor patio to enjoy the weather.  Macs is right beside music in the yard which is really convenient.  There are different drink specials everyday too.

Hfi7C3yfB3fdvwoSkyCLUg.text: Food: 4/5- never been disappointed!  Venue: 4/5- if you get cold easily, DEFINITELY bring a jacket with you. There isn't a ton of seating and it's loud but it's a rad place to watch sports and eat.   Atmosphere/Service: 4/5- Eh, I don't remember any noticeably great service or bad service except once we had a waitress that was just rude. Overrall, it's all your standard, average burger/biker joint.

_IISR2xfeqvnxxoO4WGiDw.text: Came here on a whim because the place we were originally going to ended up closing super early because "the kitchen lost power." So we came here instead. I like to say we made a good choice. We sat outside on the patio, they had picnic table's, had a nice feel. The wings here are grilled not fried so that's a good thing. I ordered the honey BBQ and they were fall off the bone good like literally. Also ordered a banana pudding for dessert that came in a tall glass mug. The BP was mediocre, taste like boxed BP, #Idefinitelyhadbetter #Iwontbeorderingthatagain #Ishouldhavegotthebrownieinstead

AdqHllRYilOLpBLvecLqNw.text: Always the same - in a good way - as in you can expect it to be tasty with good relaxed vibes. Friendly, laid back service. Outdoor area is one of the best in charlotte with numerous setups for seating.
